thread.title: Wayne Jones back at the PDC Grand Slam
thread.title_full: Wayne Jones back at the PDC Grand Slam

title: Wayne Jones back at the PDC Grand Slam
text:
Tweet 
‘The Wanderer’ will be back at Wolverhampton Civic Hall when the tournament starts on November 7, writes Craig Birch. 
The thrower from Wednesfield failed to make the cut for the first time since the 2007 established event began in 2013 and sat it out again last year. 
But Black Country fans will now have a hometown hero to cheer again in Jones, who reached the semi-finals in 2010. 
The 50-year-old travelled to Coventry City’s Ricoh Arena today for the sole PDC qualifier with his work cut out for him, needing to win four games to nab a spot. 
He prevailed from a tough draw in the first round and beat Kevin Painter 5-3, before excelling in a 5-2 victory over another formidable foe in Andrew Gilding. 
Confidence was high after a 5-2 success over James Wilson, setting up a winner-take-all tie against Devon Petersen. 
He saw off Petersen 5-3 to take one of the eight places that were on offer for the Grand Slam for winners in the fourth round. What do you think? Be the first to comment 
And the £4,500 gained in prize money makes Jones pretty much a shoo-in for the World Championship, a notion which had looked in serious doubt. 
It would be the first PDC worlds without Jones involved since 2003, but he could rubber-stamp his position after tomorrow and Sunday’s Players Championship at the same venue. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
